title: Council tax bills will soar in nine out of 10 local authorities in England
text:
News Council tax bills will soar in nine out of 10 local authorities in England Residents in many areas will see their bills rise by as much as 5% after councils were handed new powers to top up their charges Share Council tax bills will soar in nine out of 10 local authorities in England (Photo: PA) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
Nine out of 10 local authorities in England will hike council tax bills next month, a new survey has found. 
Residents in many areas will see their bills rise by as much as 5% after councils were handed new powers to top up their charges with extra money for social care . 
Only 22 councils of the 353 across England are freezing council tax in 2017/18, while just one - East Hampshire - has said it is cutting bills outright. 
The Local Government Association said that after seven years of austerity from Whitehall, councils are “unable to turn down the chance to raise desperately-needed money for local services”. Read More The major changes that will make you richer - or poorer from 1 April Some council tax bills will rise by 5% (Photo: Getty Images) 
But Tim Roache, general secretary of the public sector GMB union, called the social care levy “a sticking plaster on a gaping wound”. 
He added: “That almost every local authority is being forced to raise council tax to meet the even the basic needs of communities up and down the country shows just how far the Government have gone in abdicating responsibility for public services.” 
The near across-the-board increases mark a complete turnaround from five years ago, when nine out of 10 councils froze bills for rate-payers. Like us on Facebook
